events.message: The customer reported a rear-end collision that occurred at a traffic light, resulting in damage to the rear bumper and trunk of their car.
The claim was reviewed and appropriately categorised under the Auto Accident cluster based on the description of the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to handle this case and initiate further processing.
The customer received an acknowledgment that their claim has been officially received and is under review.
The agent requested additional documents including police report, vehicle photos, and the driver's license for claim verification.
The customer submitted all requested documents promptly, including the police report and detailed pictures of the damaged vehicle.
An investigation commenced to verify the details of the accident, review submitted evidence, and assess liability for damages.
The investigation concluded successfully, confirming the accident circumstances and validating the claim coverage.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer outlining the compensation amount for the vehicle repairs.
The customer provided positive feedback regarding the clear communication and proposed settlement offer.
The claim was officially approved after the customer accepted the settlement terms and conditions.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was successfully issued to the customer's designated bank account.
The claim was officially closed following the resolution of all matters and confirmation from the customer.
The entire claim file was archived in the system for record-keeping and future reference.
